programme.title: Zombie House Flipping
programme.desc: A 100-year-old house is being offered at a tantalizing price, virtually land value. But that could just mean it's hiding 100 years' worth of problems. The Zombie team takes on this historic renovation in hopes of having a showpiece flip as well as a sweet profit. But decades of termite damage, outdated electrical systems, and hard-to-match vintage details could turn this showpiece into a public disaster.

programme.title: Zombie House Flipping
programme.desc: Keith finds a historic house that was half renovated, and is now available at a price they could flip into one of their biggest profits ever—over 200 grand. But this old house reveals tons of problems, from an outdated electrical system, to crooked floors, to a second story with low, sloping ceilings that only a kid could love.

programme.title: Zombie House Flipping
programme.sub-title: Home.Made. Nation Presents: Zombie House Flipping - Double Down
programme.desc: Justin surprises the team with the news that he already bought a zombie house that he wants them to flip– a small, single-story home that should take only a few weeks to remodel. After running the comps in the neighborhood, the team realizes they'll make even more money off the sale if they increase the square footage and build an addition on the house. However, a series of problems with the addition highjacks the budget and turns their timeline from a few weeks into a few months.

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia.

After an explosive reunion, tensions are still high among the group as they all reunite one last time to say goodbye to one of their own.

programme.title: Matchmaker Christmas
programme.desc: As the Christmas party for a book publishing company approaches, editor Maggie volunteers to help her boss Amanda find a date. Maggie is thrown off her game when Jaxson, her old boyfriend from her college years, shows up at her work as a newly signed, successful author. Maggie would love to deny she feels anything for him still, but Jaxson isn't making it easy. She'll have to face her decisions of the past, and Amanda eyeing Jaxson, to bring together the perfect matches at Christmas.

programme.title: A Sweet Christmas Romance
programme.desc: When Holly returns home for Christmas she learns that the owner of her childhood bakery is retiring and has started a contest to give the bakery away to whoever can recreate her famous 12 Days of Christmas recipes. Holly enters, despite not being much of cook. When a local baker named Brad also enters the contest, the two adversaries end up cooking up something special together for the holidays. Adelaide Kane, Greyston Holt and Loretta Devine star.

programme.desc: Director Peter Jackson's special-effects extravaganza (it won Oscars for Sound, Sound Editing and Visual Effects) is a rip-roaring remake about the lovestruck giant ape captured on his island home and shipped to the wilds of New York City, where he falls (literally) for the wrong kind of woman. Naomi Watts plays the object of Kong's affections. Jack Black, Adrien Brody, Colin Hanks, Andy Serkis, Thomas Kretschmann, Kyle Chandler.

programme.title: Chucky
programme.desc: Incarnate Lord is in a lockdown with the Chucky dolls; Nica continues with their plan.

programme.title: Reginald The Vampire
programme.sub-title: The Last Day Of Our Acquaintance
programme.desc: Reginald finds himself in the middle of a love triangle and he navigates it to the best of his abilities. He's Swaggy Reg!

programme.title: Rob Zombie's Halloween II
programme.desc: Laurie Strode struggles to come to terms with her brother Michael's deadly return to Haddonfield, Illinois; meanwhile, Michael prepares for another reunion with his sister.

programme.title: Jigsaw
programme.desc: Serial killer Jigsaw is back to his old tricks, despite his apparent death a decade earlier. As his new victims fight to survive his twisted games, the police must solve Jigsaw's strange clues in this chilling entry of the "Saw" horror franchise.

programme.title: Magical Girl Friendship Squad
programme.desc: Alex and Daisy take a look at their friendship and the whole universe may be at stake.

programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.desc: In a bookless society, a librarian (Burgess Meredith) is condemned to death for being obsolete. But he may not go alone. Chancellor: Fritz Weaver. Guard: Harry Fleer. Subaltern: Joseph Elic. Rod Serling is the host.

programme.title: Paid Programming
programme.desc: Paid Programming.

programme.title: Paid Programming
programme.desc: Paid Programming.

programme.title: True Crime: Identity Theft
programme.desc: Every 3 seconds an American's identity is stolen. Just how safe is your 401k? Your bank account? Your home? Your credit? Crime Reporter Tom Morris Jr. investigates the identity theft epidemic. Find out how you can help protect yourself with LifeLock.

programme.title: Paid Programming
programme.desc: Paid Programming.

programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.sub-title: I Shot an Arrow Into the Air
programme.desc: A limited water supply and a nervous flight officer (Dewey Martin) imperil astronauts on a deserted asteroid. Donlin: Edward Binns. Pierson: Ted Otis. Host: Rod Serling.

programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.desc: With her head bandaged, Janet Tyler wonders if doctors have succeeded in fixing her face. Doctor: William D. Gordon. Janet's Nurse: Jennifer Howard. Smith: Edson Stroll. Leader: George Keymas. Host: Rod Serling.

programme.title: King Kong
programme.desc: Director Peter Jackson's special-effects extravaganza (it won Oscars for Sound, Sound Editing and Visual Effects) is a rip-roaring remake about the lovestruck giant ape captured on his island home and shipped to the wilds of New York City, where he falls (literally) for the wrong kind of woman. Naomi Watts plays the object of Kong's affections. Jack Black, Adrien Brody, Colin Hanks, Andy Serkis, Thomas Kretschmann, Kyle Chandler.

programme.title: Warcraft
programme.desc: A clan of orc warriors invade the realm of Azeroth after a portal is opened, endangering the humans who already live there in this stirring video-game adaptation. These events lead to a decisive struggle that will decide which race will claim the land.

programme.title: Jumanji
programme.desc: Two kids discover an old board game and when they start playing it they are greeted by a man who has spent years trapped inside the game since playing it at age 12. His only hope for freedom involves finishing the dangerous game.

programme.title: Clue
programme.desc: The whodunit board game comes to life as guests are invited to a swanky mansion to learn who is blackmailing them.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A Dog, a Squirrel, and a Fish Named Fish
programme.desc: A battle erupts between the Coopers and Sparks when the Sparks' new dog terrorizes Sheldon.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: In the Season 10 premiere, the gang deals with the awkward aftermath of an overnight liaison between Sheldon's mother and Leonard's father. Meanwhile, Penny's dysfunctional family is in town for the wedding, including her neurotic mom and drug-dealer brother.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The guys' heads are in a spin when an Air Force bigwig approaches them about their revolutionary gyroscope invention; and Bernadette is upset with Penny after she accidentally leaks a secret to the mom-to-be's coworkers about her being pregnant.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard and Leonard are putting in late nights at work and Sheldon is having trouble keeping up; Raj and a pregnant Bernadette spend a day together; and Penny and Amy take in a faculty party.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy decide to move in together when her apartment floods. Meanwhile, Howard and Bernadette become upset when Koothrappali learns the gender of the baby before they do.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: Summer Sausage, a Pocket Poncho, and Tony Danza
programme.desc: While Sheldon is busy keeping tabs on Meemaw's budding relationship with Dr. Sturgis, George Sr. and Mary attempt to bond with their other children.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: Vanilla Ice Cream, Gentleman Callers, and a Dinette Set
programme.desc: When Meemaw is pursued by two gentlemen callers, Sheldon interferes, forcing her to set some ground rule. The Season 1 finale.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A High-Pitched Buzz and Training Wheels
programme.desc: When Mary's faith is shaken by a tragedy in the community, Sheldon becomes an unlikely ally.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A Rival Prodigy and Sir Isaac Neutron
programme.desc: Dr. Sturgis bonds with Paige, another 10-year-old genius; and Sheldon's jealousy leads Meemaw to intervene. Also, Mary invites Paige's family over for a play date.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A Crisis of Faith and Octopus Aliens
programme.desc: The Season 2 premiere: Sheldon dismantles the refrigerator to stop an annoying hum, and then gets a paper route to pay for the repairs.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A Financial Secret and Fish Sauce
programme.desc: When George Sr. asks Sheldon to keep a secret from Mary, the stress of not being honest drives Sheldon to hideout at Tam's for his first sleepover.

programme.title: George Lopez
programme.sub-title: George's House Has Two Empty Wombs
programme.desc: Angie claims that she's pregnant to keep George from missing Carmen, and Vic introduces his not-too-bright young fiancée (Stacy Keibler) to the family.

programme.title: George Lopez
programme.sub-title: George Nieces a New Media Room
programme.desc: The Lopez house becomes too crowded for comfort when niece Veronica (Aimee Garcia) and her boyfriend, Mike (Jason Connery), move in.

programme.title: Wuthering Heights
programme.desc: William Wyler's Best Picture nominee is based on Emily Bronte's classic tale of the star-crossed romance between a materialistic girl (Merle Oberon) and a proud stable boy (Laurence Olivier) on the Yorkshire moors. Gregg Toland's lyrical cinematography won an Oscar.

programme.title: Queen Christina
programme.desc: Mixture of history and fiction stars Greta Garbo as the 17th-century Swedish monarch who was raised as a boy to succeed to the throne, but finds love with a dashing Spanish emissary.

programme.title: The Scarlet Empress
programme.desc: Marlene Dietrich in Josef von Sternberg's stylized interpretation of the legend of Catherine the Great. Empress Elizabeth: Louise Dresser. Grand Duke Peter: Sam Jaffe. Prince August: C. Aubrey Smith. Alexei: John Lodge. Johanna: Olive Tell. Countess: Ruthelma Stevens. Orlov: Gavin Gordon. Colorful cast, bizarre production, dazzling sets and costumes. A cinematic feast.

programme.title: Nicholas and Alexandra
programme.desc: Russia's Czar Nicholas II meets and marries the German Princess Alexandra, but their union causes tension with the disapproving Russian populace in this portrait of the country's last royal family.

programme.title: The Three Musketeers
programme.desc: In 17th-century France, a provincial upstart cadet joins the fabled Musketeers, striking up an indestructible friendship with three particular soldiers, who together thwart political conspiracies as they fight for the honor of their beloved Queen Anne.

programme.title: Marie Antoinette
programme.desc: Marie (Best Actress nominee Norma Shearer), an Austrian princess, is forced to marry the Dauphin of France and becomes embroiled in court intrigue between her father-in-law and the Duke of Orleans. When the Dauphin is unable to consummate the marriage, Marie begins an affair, but her lover ends their tryst when the king dies and Marie becomes queen. She decides to do her best as a monarch, but the Duke of Orleans continues to foment revolution against the new King.

programme.title: Mr. Blandings Builds His Dream House
programme.desc: Manhattan marrieds "trade city soot for sylvan charm" when they move to the Connecticut suburbs, where they experience an endless succession of construction nightmares and fiascoes and their new place turns into a money pit.

programme.title: Every Girl Should Be Married
programme.desc: A department store clerk is determined to get married. She meets a handsome pediatrician who is happy being a bachelor and attempts a series of schemes to win his heart.

programme.title: Ice Station Zebra
programme.desc: An American nuclear submarine is dispatched to an isolated Arctic research encampment in an attempt to be the first to reach a downed top-secret Soviet spy satellite that uses stolen Western technology, but a saboteur on the sub threatens the mission.

programme.title: The Man Who Makes the Difference
programme.desc: A profile of second-unit cinematographer John M. Stephens, including clips from his work on "Grand Prix" (1966) and "Ice Station Zebra" (1968).

programme.title: Something of Value
programme.desc: Two close friends from childhood grow up and find themselves in conflict, on opposite sides of a bloody Mau Mau uprising in Kenya.

programme.title: Giant
programme.desc: Best Picture based on the Edna Ferber bestseller about Texas cattlemen, oil, troubled romances and racial injustice chronicles the lives of one proud family from the 1930s to the '50s. James Dean's final film; George Stevens won a Best Director Oscar.

programme.title: Lord Jim
programme.desc: Richard Brooks' adaptation of Joseph Conrad's novel about a British seaman (Peter O'Toole) in the Orient. Eli Wallach, James Mason, Daliah Lavi. Cornelius: Curt Jurgens.

programme.title: The Last of Sheila
programme.desc: A filmmaker invites six movie-business types on a weeklong yacht voyage on the Mediterranean, where they engage in a role-playing game that turns murderous.

programme.title: The Verdict
programme.desc: An alcoholic lawyer thinks he can make some quick cash getting a settlement for the family of a woman who is in a coma after being operated on at a Catholic hospital. However, he becomes emotionally involved in the case, turns down the offer, and takes the powerful institution to court.

programme.title: The Mackintosh Man
programme.desc: John Huston directed this espionage melodrama about a secret agent's Cold War mission. Paul Newman, Dominique Sanda, James Mason. Mackintosh: Harry Andrews. Slade: Ian Bannen. Brown: Michael Hordern. Soames-Trevelyan: Nigel Patrick. Brunskill: Peter Vaughan. Judge: Roland Culver.

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: Suspense yarn about a motley gang of opportunists seeking a fortune in Nazi gold, hidden in East Germany. Telly Savalas, Robert Culp, James Mason. Prior: Aldo Ray. Schmidt: Gunther Meisner. Holtz: Wolfgang Lukschy. Dr. Maar: Adrian Hoven. Dohlberg: Charles Korvin. Schlager: Richard Warner.

programme.title: The Sea Gull
programme.desc: An adaptation of Anton Chekhov's slice-of-life play about love, hate and despair in rural 19th-century Russia.

programme.title: The Viking
programme.desc: Silent epic about explorer Leif Eriksson and his voyage from Norway to the east coast of North America, complete with a raid on England and a mutiny fomented by the first mate.

programme.title: Ariel
programme.desc: This colorful adventure tells the story of an impetuous mermaid princess named Ariel who falls in love with the very human Prince Eric and puts everything on the line for the chance to be with him. Memorable songs and characters -- including the villainous sea witch Ursula.

programme.title: Arctic Fury
programme.desc: Factual story about a downed doctor-flier's efforts to reach a plague-stricken village. Del Cambre, Fred Smith, Eve Miller, Gloria Petrov. Interestingly filmed on location.

programme.title: Winter Light
programme.desc: After the death of his wife, a priest loses faith. He goes on a search for God, conversing with a wide variety of people, both devout and faithless, against the backdrop of a harsh, winter landscape.

programme.title: Mammals
programme.desc: A Michelin star chef's world implodes when he discovers shocking secrets about his pregnant wife. He finds himself hunting for answers with the help of his brother-in-law.

programme.title: The Thing From Another World
programme.desc: A team of scientists at an Arctic research station near the crash site of a UFO unearth a mysterious figure frozen in ice, and when it thaws the unearthly monster goes on a murderous rampage. Remade by John Carpenter in 1982.

programme.title: Snow Devils
programme.desc: Mixture of interplanetary adventure and Abominable Snowman thriller. Jack Stuart (Giacomo Rossi Stuart), Amber Collins (Ombretta Colli), Peter Martell, Renato Baldini, Halina Zalewska. A.k.a. "Snow Demons."

programme.title: Snow Trail
programme.desc: Three bank robbers, Eijima, Nojiri, and Takasugi, flee the police and escape into the mountains. At an inn high in the Japanese Alps, Eijima and Nojiri encounter a young woman and her father, as well as Honda, a mountaineer. The inn folk do not realize their guests are wanted criminals and the visitors are treated with great kindness. Honda volunteers to lead them over the mountains, but Eijima's paranoia endangers all of them as they make the perilous trip.

programme.title: Christmas in Connecticut
programme.desc: The columnist for a national housekeeping magazine, as part of a promotional stunt, welcomes a returning war hero into her country estate, the only problem is she's a klutz in the kitchen, where she's never been at home on the range.

programme.title: The Bishop's Wife
programme.desc: Best Picture nominee about a clergyman whose prayers for divine guidance in his fund-raising efforts are answered in the form of a handsome, personable guardian angel who attempts to solve all his social and domestic problems. Remade in 1996 as "The Preacher's Wife."

programme.title: Meet Me in St. Louis
programme.desc: Americana tunefest set against the backdrop of the impending 1904 World's Fair in St. Louis, as a family learn their father's business is transferring him to New York City, and his four daughters argue that they don't want to move. Songs include "The Boy Next Door," "The Trolley Song" and "Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas."

programme.title: Blue Steel
programme.desc: After a robbery, a psychotic broker steals the service revolver belonging to a rookie female cop. She is unaware of this even as he begins pursuing her romantically, and killing total strangers around town with the weapon.

programme.title: Road Games
programme.desc: A truck driver hunts a serial-killer who has been murdering hitchhikers. To accomplish his goal, he uses a pretty young hitchhiker as bait.

programme.title: The Corvair in Action
programme.desc: Automobile promotional film about the 1960 Chevrolet Corvair shows the car participating a variety of road tests.

programme.title: Harold Lloyd's World of Comedy
programme.desc: Collection of daredevil, slapstick scenes from the comedian's movies, including 'Safety Last' (1923), 'Hot Water' (1924), 'Girl Shy' (1924), 'The Freshman' (1925) and 'Why Worry?' (1926).

programme.title: Victoria and Vancouver Gateways to Canada
programme.desc: A visit to the capital of British Columbia and to its largest city.

programme.title: Cowboy Cavalier
programme.desc: Crooning cowboy Jimmy Wakely and sidekick Dub Taylor come to the aid of a damsel in distress. Louis Armstrong, Jan Bryant, Steve Clark, Douglas Evans, Carol Henry, Milburn Morante, Bud Osborne, William Ruhl, Claire Whitney. Directed by Derwin Abrahams.

programme.title: The New Adventures of Tarzan: Doom's Brink
programme.desc: On his way to find his missing friend, Tarzan assists Major Matling in his search through the Mayan ruins for an idol containing a powerful formula.

programme.title: Popeye's 20th Anniversary
programme.desc: Animated versions of movie stars gather to celebrate Popeye's 20th anniversary as a cartoon character. The film includes excerpts from the shorts "Tops in the Big Top" and "Rodeo Romeo."

programme.title: Dead End Kids on Dress Parade
programme.desc: The Kids are scrubbed up and reformed at military school. Rollins: Billy Halop. Slip: Leo Gorcey. Ronny: Bobby Jordan. Georgie: Gabriel Dell. Johnny: Huntz Hall. Dutch: Bernard Punsley. Murphy: Frankie Thomas. A.k.a. "On Dress Parade." William Clemens directed.

programme.title: Jack Pot
programme.desc: An entry in the "Crime Does Not Pay" series examining the evils of gambling and bookmaking. Tom Neal, Ann Morriss. Directed by Roy Rowland.

programme.title: I'll See You in My Dreams
programme.desc: True story of songwriter Gus Kahn as he rises to success with the encouragement and help of his co-worker and future wife, Grace. They become partners and soon married as Kahn's career progresses into television and film.

programme.title: Mad Love
programme.desc: Deranged surgeon, Dr. Gogol, pines for actress Yvonne Orlac who is planning a break from acting to tour with her pianist husband, Stephen. After an accident mangles Stephen's hands, Gogol replaces them with the hands of a dead knife-wielding murderer which appear to have retained the urge to use knives as weapons. Based on the novel "Les Mains D'Orlac" by Maurice Renard.

programme.title: Air Force
programme.desc: This World War II tribute to the B-17 Flying Fortress "Mary Ann" follows the exploits of the American bomber crew serving in the Pacific theater after its involvement with the Japanese at Pearl Harbor. George Amy won a Best Editing Oscar.

programme.title: Rio Bravo
programme.desc: In 1860s Texas, a small-town county sheriff, his cantankerous old deputy, an alcoholic lawman and a young gunslinger try to keep a murderous thug jailed long enough for the U.S. marshal to arrive on the scene.

programme.title: La Reina del Sur
programme.desc: Landero no sabe por qué le cuenta a Teresa su más íntimo secreto, pero lo hace.

programme.title: El fuego del destino
programme.desc: Con gran cuidado y un orden casi obsesivo, Celebi encaja las piezas del rompecabezas. Sabe que siendo muy juicioso y precavido es la única forma en la cual logrará escapar de la justicia y no terminar encerrado en la cárcel. En tanto, Ozan está sumamente complicado y se enfrenta cara a cara con la muerte.

Luego, una historia entre dos partes en conflicto terminarán comprobando que los colmos también existen en la justicia.

programme.title: Caso Cerrado
programme.desc: Santiago fue adoptado por Clara, pero la ternura con la que ella lo cuidó y la falta de afecto que él tenía confundieron al niño. Ahora, el tiene 18 años y está enamorado de su mamá.

programme.desc: La jueza escucha el testimonio de Cristopher, quien le narra su historia personal.
